div.l: Was noon so hardy / that wente bi the way
That with hir durste rage / or onys play
But if he wolde be slayn / of Symkyn
With panade / or with knyff / or boydekyn
For ielous folk ben ꝑperilous / eủer mo
Algate thei wolde / here wivis / wende so
And eke for she was / somdel smoterliche
She was a digne / as water in a diche
As ful of hoker / ⁊and of bismare
Hir thoughte that a lady / shulde hir spare
What for hir kynrede / ⁊and hir nortelrie
That she hadde lerned / in the Nonnerie
A dought̉er hadde thei / bitwix hem two
Of ·xxᵗⁱ· yere / withouten eny mo
Sauyng a child / that was of halff yere age
In cradel it lay / ⁊and was a ꝓproper page
This wenche thikke / ⁊and wel I growen was
With camoise nose / ⁊and yghen gray as glas
With buttokes brode / ⁊and brestis rounde ⁊and highe
But right faire was hir heere / I wil not lye
¶ The ꝑperson of the town̄ / for she was feyre
In purpose was / to make hir his heyre
Both of his catel / ⁊and his mesuage
And straunge he it made / of hir mariage
His purpose was / to bistowe hir highe
In to some worthi blood / of auncestrie
For holy chirches good / mot ben dispended
On holy chirche blood / that is descended
Ther fore he wolde / his holy blood honour
Though that he holy chirche / sholde devour
¶ Gret sokyn hath this Miller / oute of doute
With whete ⁊and malt / of al the londe a boute
And namely ther was / agrete Collige
Men clepith the Soler halle / at Cambrige
There was here whete / ⁊and eke here malt I grounde
And on a day it happid / in a stounde
